snippet: Just months after it was defeated in the Senate, delicate talks have begun on a new background-check measure that advocates hope could change enough votes from no to yes.
abstract: Democratic leaders in Congress and White House renew their push for gun legislation, just months after it was defeated in Senate, amid delicate talks on a new background-check measure that advocates hope could change enough votes from no to yes.
lead_paragraph: Just months after it was defeated in the Senate, delicate talks have begun on a new background-check measure that advocates hope could change enough votes from no to yes.

headline.main: Democrats Quietly Renew Push for Gun Measures
headline.print_headline: Democrats Quietly Renew Push for Gun Measures
